p: Unlike influenza viruses, coronaviruses are enveloped RNA viruses (with non-segmented positive polar RNA) of the Nidovirales order, Coronaviridae family and Orthocoronavirinae subfamily (Fehr and Perlman 2015). Coronaviral virions have a spherical shape with the typical bulbous projections (Neuman et al. 2006; Bárcena et al. 2009). The viral envelope is made of a bilipid layer where S, M and E proteins are fixed (Lai and Cavanagh 1997; de Haan and Rottier 2005) (Fig. 1B).
